de.mrapp.android.preference

Class SeekBarPreference

  • java.lang.Object
    • Preference
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractDialogPreference
        • de.mrapp.android.preference.SeekBarPreference

  • public class SeekBarPreference
extends AbstractDialogPreference
    A preference, which allows to select a value from a continuous range via a seek bar. When interacting with the preference, the seek bar is shown within a dialog. The chosen value will only be persisted, if confirmed by the user. The preference can be used to select floating point values if a specific number of decimals or integer values. Furthermore it is possible to customize the appearance of the dialog and to set a step size, the currently chosen value is increased or decreased by, when moving the seek bar.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Constructor Detail

      • SeekBarPreference

        public SeekBarPreference(Context context)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a continuous range via a seek bar.
        Parameters:
        context - The context in which to store the preference's value as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • SeekBarPreference

        public SeekBarPreference(Context context,
                 AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a continuous range via a seek bar. This constructor is called when a preference is being constructed from an XML file, supplying attributes that were specified in the XML file. This version uses a default style of 0, so the only attribute values applied are those in the context's theme and the given attribute set.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context this preference is associated with and through which it can access the current theme, resources, SharedPreferences, etc, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet. The attribute set may not be null

      • SeekBarPreference

        public SeekBarPreference(Context context,
                 AttributeSet attributeSet,
                 int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a continuous range via a seek bar. This constructor allows subclasses to use their own base style when they are inflating.
        Parameters:
        context - The context in which to store Preference value as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the preference's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • SeekBarPreference

        public SeekBarPreference(Context context,
                 AttributeSet attributeSet,
                 int defaultStyle,
                 int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a continuous range via a seek bar. This constructor allows subclasses to use their own base style when they are inflating.
        Parameters:
        context - The context in which to store Preference value as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attribute set, the preference's attributes should be obtained from, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public final float getValue()
        Returns the currently persisted value of the preference.
        Returns:
        The currently persisted value as a Float value

      • setValue

        public final void setValue(float value)
        Sets the current value of the preference. By setting a value, it will be persisted.
        Parameters:
        value - The value, which should be set, as a Float value. The value must be between the minimum and the maximum value, the preference allows to select

      • getMinValue

        public final int getMinValue()
        Returns the minimum value, the preference allows to choose.
        Returns:
        The minimum value, the preference allows to choose, as an Integer value

      • setMinValue

        public final void setMinValue(int minValue)
        Sets the minimum value, the preference should allow to choose.
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimum value, which should be set, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the maximum value, the preference allows to choose

      • getMaxValue

        public final int getMaxValue()
        Returns the maximum value, the preference allows to choose.
        Returns:
        The maximum value, the preference allows to choose, as an Integer value

      • setMaxValue

        public final void setMaxValue(int maxValue)
        Sets the maximum value, the preference should allow to choose.
        Parameters:
        maxValue - The maximum value, which should be set, as an Integer value. The value must be greater than the minimum value, that preference allows to choose

      • getDefaultValue

        public final float getDefaultValue()
        Returns the default value of the preference.
        Returns:
        The default value of the preference, as a Float value

      • getRange

        public final int getRange()
        Returns the range of values, the preference allows to choose from.
        Returns:
        The range of values, the preference allows to choose from, as an Integer value

      • getStepSize

        public final int getStepSize()
        Returns the step size, the value is increased or decreased by, when moving the seek bar.
        Returns:
        The step size, the value is increased or decreased by, when moving the seek bar, as an Integer value

      • setStepSize

        public final void setStepSize(int stepSize)
        Sets the step size, the value should be increased or decreased by, when moving the seek bar.
        Parameters:
        stepSize - The step size, which should be set, as an Integer value. The value must be between 1 and the maximum value or -1, if the preference should allow to select a value from a continuous range

      • getDecimals

        public final int getDecimals()
        Returns the number of decimals of the floating point numbers, the preference allows to choose. If the number of decimals is set to 0, the preference only allows to choose integer values.
        Returns:
        The number of decimals of the floating point numbers, the preference allows to choose, as an Integer value

      • setDecimals

        public final void setDecimals(int decimals)
        Sets the number of decimals of the floating point numbers, the preference should allow to choose. If the number of decimals is set to 0, the preference will only allow to choose integer values.
        Parameters:
        decimals - The number of decimals, which should be set, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 0. If the value is set to 0, the preference will only allow to choose integer values

      • getSuffix

        public final String getSuffix()
        Returns the suffix, which is attached to the current value for textual representation.
        Returns:
        The suffix, which is attached to the current value for textual representation, as a String or null, if no suffix is attached

      • setSuffix

        public final void setSuffix(String suffix)
        Sets the suffix, which should be attached to the current value for textual representation.
        Parameters:
        suffix - The suffix, which should be set, as a String or null, if no suffix should be attached

      • setSuffix

        public final void setSuffix(int suffixResId)
        Sets the suffix, which should be attached to the current value for textual representation.
        Parameters:
        suffixResId - The resource id of the suffix, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • getFloatingPointSeparator

        public final String getFloatingPointSeparator()
        Returns the symbol, which is used to separate floating point numbers for textual representation.
        Returns:
        The symbol, which is used to separate floating point numbers for textual representation, as a String

      • setFloatingPointSeparator

        public final void setFloatingPointSeparator(String floatingPointSeparator)
        Sets the symbol, which should be used to separate floating point numbers for textual representation.
        Parameters:
        floatingPointSeparator - The symbol, which should be set, as a String. The length of the string must be 1

      • setFloatingPointSeparator

        public final void setFloatingPointSeparator(int floatingPointSeparatorResId)
        Sets the symbol, which should be used to separate floating point numbers for textual representation.
        Parameters:
        floatingPointSeparatorResId - The resource id of the symbol, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • isProgressShown

        public final boolean isProgressShown()
        Returns, whether the currently selected value of the seek bar is shown, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the currently selected value of the seek bar is shown, false otherwise

      • showProgress

        public final void showProgress(boolean showProgress)
        Sets, whether the currently selected value of the seek bar should be shown, or not.
        Parameters:
        showProgress - True, if the currently selected value of the seek bar should be shown, false otherwise

      • getSummaries

        public final String[] getSummaries()
        Returns the summaries, which are shown depending on the currently persisted value.
        Returns:
        The summaries, which are shown depending on the currently persisted value, as a String array or null, if no summaries are shown depending on the currently persisted value
